intro: [WRONG START] Macleodium oblongum, commonly known as the narrow-leafed macledium, is a flowering plant native to the Andes region of South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its elongated, narrow leaves and showy, pentagonal flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in high-altitude environments and is often found in rocky or mountainous terrain. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and plant enthusiasts.
